prompt: Which Arctic mammal has a unique long ivory tusk?
icl_complete: The Arctic mammal with a unique long ivory tusk is the narwhal. Narwhals are known for their distinctive tusks, which are actually elongated left canine teeth that can grow up to 10 feet in length. These tusks have a spiral shape and are primarily found in males, although some females may also have short tusks. Narwhals inhabit Arctic waters and are well-adapted to cold environments. Their tusks are thought to play a role in mating rituals and social interactions.
